channel.title: math.GN updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GN updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On the closure of a plane ray that limits onto itself
item.description: arXiv:2509.13598v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We show that the closure of any self-entwined ray in the plane must contain an uncountable collection of pairwise-disjoint subcontinua. This is false in dimension three.
item.dc:creator: David S. Lipham

item.title: No covering with nowhere dense \textsf{P}-sets in the Cohen model
item.description: arXiv:2507.22476v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We prove that if less than $\aleph_{\omega}$-many Cohen reals are added to a model of \textsf{CH}, then $\omega^{\ast}$ can not be covered by nowhere dense \textsf{P}-sets (equivalently, there is an ultrafilter on $\omega$ that does not contain a tower).
item.dc:creator: Alan Dow, Osvaldo Guzm\'an
